conclusion: Objects A and B are positioned above the table and are indicated to move downward due to gravity.
Objects C, D, E, and F are stationary on the table and are solid blocks of different colors and shapes.
Two cloth-like materials are pinned to the table, one red (on the left) and one patterned (on the right).
Gravity causes objects A and B to fall downward, and when they reach the table, they will land on the cloths and come into contact with the stationary objects C, D, E, and F.
As objects A and B land on the cloths, their weight will exert force on the cloths, causing them to deform or stretch downward.
Object A will land on the red cloth and come into contact with objects C and D, causing the red cloth to deform around these objects.
Object B will land on the patterned cloth and come into contact with objects E and F, causing the patterned cloth to deform around these objects.
The cloths will stretch and form indentations around the stationary objects C, D, E, and F, while the stationary objects will remain in place.
The deformation of the cloths will create visible dips or valleys where objects A and B landed.

When objects A and B fall due to gravity and land on the cloths at the location of objects C, D, E, and F, the cloths will deform and stretch downward, creating indentations around the stationary objects.
